title: Labor Force Participation - Combined Data Structure
purpose: Dual-source approach for Offering Memorandum with explicit dating

census_baseline.interpretation: Loudoun County's LFPR of 74.1% is 10.6 percentage points higher than the national average, indicating an exceptionally engaged workforce.
census_baseline.recommendation: Use as baseline metric for OM comparisons due to lower margin of error and methodological consistency across geographies.

census_supplemental.note: Most recent single-year estimate. LFPR difference from 5-Year (-0.7%) is within margin of error.
census_supplemental.use_case: Supplement 5-Year baseline when highlighting recent trends, but note higher MOE.

bls_current.seasonal_note: Data is NOT seasonally adjusted. Year-over-year comparisons recommended.

methodology_notes: Census LFPR is pre-calculated and methodologically consistent across geographies
Census 5-Year estimates have ~2x lower margin of error than 1-Year
BLS provides more current data but requires population denominator from Census to calculate LFPR
BLS county-level data is not seasonally adjusted - use YoY comparisons for trends
Recommended approach: Use Census 5-Year for baseline rate, BLS for trend/trajectory
Data center employment note: Many tech workers are based in Fairfax/Arlington offices while infrastructure is physically located in Loudoun
